Phillip E. Johnson (June 18, 1940 – November 2, 2019) was an American writer and law professor. He was the UC Berkeley law professor and co-founder of the pseudo-scientific intelligent design movement. He was an author of the "Wedge strategy" and co-founder of the Discovery Institute's Center for Science and Culture (CSC).
He said of himself "the father of the intelligent design movement".
Johnson died on November 2, 2019 at his Berkeley, California home at the age of 79.
